1.headline: Get in touch ASAP
1.text: Taking the initiative to contact your landlord will help build trust and allow your landlord to make plans on their end.

2.headline: Make yourself available
2.text: Answer any calls, emails, or texts from your landlord as soon as you get them. Being responsive respects their time and lets them know you aren't going to disappear.

3.headline: Offer another solution
3.text: Suggesting a temporary, alternate solution such as a partial payment or a payment plan is a sign of good faith and lets your landlord know you eventually intend to pay.

4.headline: Apologize, but no excuses
4.text: It may help to explain your situation if it's an emergency, but only if it leads to finding a viable payment solution.

1.headline: Contact your local 2-1-1
1.text: They can connect you with resources related to housing (availability varies by location).

2.headline: Find a Catholic Charities agency
2.text: They can help you with services related to housing (availability varies by location).

3.headline: Apply for a Modest Needs grant
3.text: These small, emergency grants are allocated to low-income workers. Find out more by visiting their website.
